io.realm

Class RealmResults<E extends RealmObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • io.realm.RealmResults<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The class of objects in this list
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>

    public class RealmResults<E extends RealmObject>
extends java.util.AbstractList<E>
    This class holds all the matches of a RealmQuery for a given Realm. The objects are not copied from the Realm to the RealmResults list, but are just referenced from the RealmResult instead. This saves memory and increases speed.

    RealmResults are live views, which means that if it is on an Looper thread, it will automatically update its query results after a transaction has been committed. If on a non-looper thread, Realm.refresh() must be called to update the results.

    Updates to RealmObjects from a RealmResults list must be done from within a transaction and the modified objects are persisted to the Realm file during the commit of the transaction.

    A RealmResults object cannot be passed between different threads.

    Notice that a RealmResults is never null not even in the case where it contains no objects. You should always use the size() method to check if a RealmResults is empty or not.

    See Also:
    RealmQuery.findAll(), Realm.allObjects(Class), Realm.beginTransaction()

        public void sort(java.lang.String fieldName,
        boolean sortAscending)
        Sort existing @{link io.realm.RealmResults}.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field name to sort by. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
        sortAscending - The direction to sort by; if true ascending, otherwise descending You can use the constants SORT_ORDER_ASCENDING and SORT_ORDER_DESCENDING for readability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if field name does not exist.

      • average

        public double average(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Returns the average of a given field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field to calculate average on. Only properties of type int, float and double are supported.
        Returns:
        The average for the given field amongst objects in an RealmList. This will be of type double for both float and double field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if field is not int, float or double.

      • remove

        public E remove(int index)
        Removes an object at a given index. This also deletes the object from the underlying Realm. Using this method while iterating the list can result in a undefined behavior. Use RealmResults.RealmResultsIterator.remove() instead.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.List<E extends RealmObject>
        Overrides:
        remove in class java.util.AbstractList<E extends RealmObject>
        Parameters:
        index - The array index identifying the object to be removed.
        Returns:
        Always return null.

      • removeLast

        public void removeLast()
        Removes and returns the last object in the list. This also deletes the object from the underlying Realm. Using this method while iterating the list can result in a undefined behavior. Use removeLast() instead.

        Removes all objects from the list. This also deletes the objects from the underlying Realm.
